solution_line_template: Allie has {total_toys} - {one_toy_removed} = <<{total_toys}-{one_toy_removed}={remaining_toys}>>{remaining_toys} toys of the same value.

Without the value of the one ${worth_of_one_toy} toy, all {remaining_toys} other toys are worth in total {total_worth} - {worth_of_one_toy} = $<<{total_worth}-{worth_of_one_toy}={worth_of_remaining_toys}>>{worth_of_remaining_toys}.
That would mean, that one of the other toys is worth {worth_of_remaining_toys} / {remaining_toys} = $<<{worth_of_remaining_toys}/{remaining_toys}={cost_of_one_other_toy}>>{cost_of_one_other_toy}.
